name.description: Globally unique name for your project. May be in form of vendor/project

main-image.description: This should point to your main container name in images section, like application server

repository.description: This git repository will be cloned as a volume on target container

target-volume.description: If an image uses a volume with this name, clone this repo there

fixed-ports.description: Since itâ€™s primarily for dev environment, crane tries to always expose the same ports for these services on the host system

oneOf.description: The fixed port is calculated based on the fixed-port items count, so you may want to pad it with nulls for future

images.description: list of docker containers to build. Dockerfiles for these should be placed in `./images/image-name/Dockerfile`

ports.description: Expose those TCP ports to the host server

volumes.description: mount these volumes under `/home/volume-name`. They will be shared from the host system path: `~/.crane/project-name/volumes/volume-name`

require.description: start those containers first, and then pass their exposed ports as via ENV, f.i. `$IMAGE_NAME_PORT`

useTTY.description: Some containers have to be started with the TTY option, -t

remoteUser.description: If you want to SSH into the container, use this username

oneOf.description: This is just a base image for other images, just build it, do not start it

current-target.description: The default target host to start the project on. It must be a valid key from `targets`

targets.description: Possible target hosts to start the project on. They should be a valid ssh target, f.i. user@example.com
